Zak Knight.Action: Mimics The Rock’s victory celebration with enthusiasm and dreams of becoming a wrestler.
Wrestles with his sister over the remote and pulls her arm behind her back, causing her pain.
Transfixed by The Rock’s match, mimics his moves and victory celebration, rehearsing skillfully.
Engages in a physical struggle with his sister over the remote, escalating to choking her.
Receives correction from his father on how to apply a choke hold properly, indicating lack of skill.
Chokes his sister Raya during wrestling practice, causing her distress.
Releases Raya when their mother Julia intervenes.
Pipes up to suggest an alternative opponent for Raya, showing support.
Adjusts his arm position during a choke hold under Ricky's guidance, showing willingness to learn and improve technique.
Applies a choke hold on Raya but is quickly escaped and twisted into pain, indicating a lack of skill or control in the move.
Pipes up with a suggestion to Raya about not wrestling a random girl, showing some initiative and engagement in problem-solving.
Encourages Raya by comparing wrestling to a dance and reassures her to follow his lead.
Smiles at Raya after the crowd cheers, sharing a moment of mutual encouragement and support.
Engages playfully and supportively with his younger sister in the wrestling match, helping her gain confidence.
Encourages Raya by comparing wrestling to a dance and advises her to follow him, showing confidence and teaching ability.
Successfully performs wrestling moves that excite the crowd and boost Raya's confidence.
Smiles reassuringly at Raya after a successful move, demonstrating emotional intelligence and leadership.
Bolts into the ring to help his sister Raya by attacking Ricky and turning the match in their favor.
Raises his sister’s hand after their victory and winks at her, silently saying 'Good job'.
Bolts from the wings confidently, kicks Ricky in the belly, executes a swinging leg hook fireman’s carry slam, pins Ricky successfully, and wins the match alongside Raya.
Winks at Raya and raises her hand after the win, showing confidence and camaraderie.
Winks at Raya and says 'Good job' after their win.
Raises his sister’s hand and winks at Raya saying 'Good job' after winning the match.
Listens keenly with Raya during the phone call to the American woman from WWE.
Drives the van confidently through run-down working class suburb streets, navigating past boarded-up shops and graffiti.
Notices a solitary teenager on a playground swing-set, showing awareness and observation skills.
Arrives in the van, beeps horn to stop kids from dangerous activity, kids respond positively and climb aboard.
Chases after Paulie who is selling drugs, pursues him relentlessly through streets and houses to stop him.
Arrives just in time to stop a dangerous situation with the trolley, showing awareness and timely intervention.
Chases Paulie through multiple obstacles and successfully apprehends him, demonstrating physical capability, determination, and quick decision-making.
Rifles through Paulie’s pockets, finds drugs, and pushes Paulie to dispose of them in a dust-bin.
Clips Paulie around the head after a sarcastic comment.
Rifles through Paulie’s pockets, finds drugs, confronts him confidently, and forces him to dispose of the drugs.
Clips Paulie around the head impulsively after Paulie suggests the drugs belong to the old lady.
Drives the van with local kids singing along to heavy metal, creating a lively, inclusive atmosphere.
Notices a teenager sitting alone on a swing and makes a U-turn to approach him.
Introduces himself and his sister warmly to the teenager and invites him to join their wrestling school.
Responds calmly and politely despite the teenager's rude dismissal.
Drives the van confidently with Raya and local kids, showing leadership and control in a lively environment.
Notices a teenager sitting alone and decides to approach him, attempting to engage him in wrestling.
Introduces himself and his sister politely and offers an invitation to the wrestling school, demonstrating social skills and initiative.
Fails to persuade Calum to join the wrestling school; Calum reacts negatively and walks away.
Encourages Calum by emphasizing wrestling makes you invincible despite real-life problems.
Mocks Calum's partial sightedness by sarcastically asking if he'll listen to porn today.
Leads and instructs the Strays in wrestling moves patiently and clearly.
Jokes about Paulie being sexually aroused by his sister, teasing but in a friendly, humorous way.
Pins a Stray wrestler to the mat with a half-nelson and instructs others on wrestling technique clearly and confidently.
Responds to Paulie's inappropriate behavior with a quick, confident command (fifty press-ups) and a witty remark, maintaining control of the situation.
Shows tenacity by scurrying after Calum despite Calum's partial sightedness and initial dismissal.
Dismisses Calum's complaint about his sight with a sarcastic remark instead of addressing the issue seriously.
Smiles warmly as Calum enters the gym, follows Raya's gaze attentively.
Smiles confidently as Calum enters the gym and helps him into the ring.
Introduces Calum to the group and tries to reassure him after a pro-wrestler slams onto the mat.
Engages in light teasing with others about Calum's vision, contributing to group laughter including Calum.
Shares a private, serious conversation with Courtney and Raya, leading to Raya's wild surprise.
Argues with Julia about Courtney's parents, showing concern about making a good impression.

Admits uncertainty about Calum's condition when asked by Raya.
Initiates a private conversation with Courtney and Raya, indicating he is managing sensitive information or situations.
Argues with Julia about Courtney's parents, showing some awareness of social dynamics but also a slight defensiveness.
Asks Ricky to put a shirt on for dinner to make a good impression, tries to moderate language out of respect for Courtney's family, and encourages family to act normal for Courtney's sake.
Jokes about being kind and considerate except in the bedroom, showing a playful and sincere side.
Smiles pleased when Julia winks at him, indicating friendly and warm social interaction.
Asks Ricky to put on a shirt for dinner to make a good impression and requests the family to moderate their language for Courtney's sake.

Erupts in celebration with hugs, high-fives, and kisses Courtney after receiving the WWE call.
Mutes the call to privately discuss the WWE tryout opportunity with Raya and their parents before responding, then responds calmly and confidently to confirm availability.
Immediately erupts in celebration with family and friends after hearing the WWE tryout invitation, showing excitement but then quickly regains composure to handle the call professionally.
Steps in to ease the tension when Daphne and Hugh look unnerved after hearing about Roy's imprisonment.
Explains the significance of making it big in WWE with confidence and clarity.
Steps in to ease tension when family members are unnerved by news about their step-brother.
Jokes to Hugh 'Don’t worry. The baby’s mine.' to lighten the mood after shocking news.
Tries to stop Courtney from asking Roy about his past, indicating discomfort with confrontation.
Calmly reassures Hugh by claiming the baby is his, defusing tension.
Avoids directly answering Courtney's question about Roy's situation, causing discomfort.
Reassures Courtney that Roy is not like him, presenting himself as the strong and sensible one in the family.
Notices Raya’s distant, anxious behavior and gently questions her well-being.
Pulls Raya close to comfort her and offers encouragement about her wrestling prospects.
Uses humor to lighten Raya’s mood when she expresses anxiety.
Reassures Courtney by confidently stating Roy is not like his troubled self and that Zak is the strong one with his head screwed on.
Notices Raya's anxious behavior and directly addresses it, showing emotional intelligence and attentiveness.
Encourages and motivates Raya by affirming her wrestling ability and heritage, boosting her confidence.
Shows excitement and awareness of the environment, notices Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson and points him out to Raya, indicating observational skills and situational awareness.
Gives Raya a head start by stumbling back when pushed, showing a playful and supportive attitude but no direct demonstration of skill or confidence.
Whispers advice to his sister Raya during the match, encouraging her to play out moves more and sell snaps harder; she listens and applies his advice.
Gives strategic advice to his sister Raya during the match, showing awareness and leadership.
Executes a finishing move 'Zak Attack' successfully and pins an opponent, demonstrating skill and confidence.

Grins and cheers with unbridled glee at Dwayne's promo, showing friendly enthusiasm and support.
Raises hand again to answer Hutch's question about 'a promo', demonstrating attentiveness and willingness to participate.
Drops a contender with his finishing move 'Zak Attack' and pins him for the win.
Correctly answers Hutch's questions about wrestling terminology ('Going over' and 'A promo') confidently.
Makes a joke apologizing to a woman after cursing, showing awareness and politeness.
Leans past a woman to apologize to another man, which embarrasses the man and causes laughter.
Delivers a confident and passionate promo, showing deep knowledge and enthusiasm for wrestling, and uses humor to engage the group.
Paces nervously backstage, showing anxiety before competition.
Calmly confirms Raya's wrestling family background to Dwayne, demonstrating awareness and social intelligence.
Asks Dwayne Johnson for a favor despite potential embarrassment, showing openness and humility.

Asks Dwayne to perform a move on him despite it being unusual, showing confidence and willingness to take a risk to fulfill a personal dream.
Remains composed and supportive while waiting nervously in line with other contenders, showing emotional control and focus.
Jokes about being called a jabroni after Dwayne leaves, indicating a lighthearted attitude but possibly undermining seriousness.
After not being chosen, he breaks the silence and tells Raya 'I'm proud of you.'
Trails behind Raya, still shell-shocked and unsure how to respond.
Remains focused and composed during the tense announcement moment.
Is paralysed and uncomprehending when not selected, showing difficulty managing disappointment.
Breaks the silence to express pride in his sister despite his own disappointment.
Trails behind Raya, appearing shell-shocked and less proactive in pursuing Hutch.

Drives home in silence after the confrontation, not engaging in conversation with Raya despite the tension.
Breaks the ice with the group after the decision, showing willingness to face disappointment openly.

Encourages Raya by reminding her that her decision is not just for herself but for the family, showing emotional intelligence and leadership.
After the decision is made, he walks away silently, avoiding confrontation or further discussion with Raya, indicating possible avoidance or lack of assertiveness.
Upon returning to the gym, he openly and clearly communicates the outcome to the group, breaking the silence and addressing the situation directly.
Breaks the ice in a quiet room by enthusiastically celebrating his sister's achievement, clapping and whistling to encourage others to join in applause.
Watches stoically as others celebrate his sister, showing restraint and respect without overshadowing her moment.
Sits alone smoking, reluctant to join family at the airport for his sister's departure, citing being busy.
Breaks the ice in an awkward moment by encouraging celebration and applause for his sister's achievement.
Watches stoically as others celebrate his sister, showing emotional restraint and composure.
Sits smoking and appears distracted or disengaged when told to leave for the airport, making excuses to avoid going immediately.
Gives Raya practical advice to stay strong and not cry at the airport, showing concern for her emotional well-being.
Responds vaguely and avoids explaining what he is busy with when Julia asks, showing emotional distance and lack of openness.
Shares a stilted, awkward embrace with Raya before she leaves, indicating some difficulty expressing warmth openly.
Gives practical advice to Raya about handling emotions at the airport, showing awareness and emotional intelligence.
Avoids specifying what he is busy with when asked, responding vaguely with 'Stuff.'
Engages in a stilted, awkward farewell embrace with Raya, indicating some social discomfort or lack of ease in emotional situations.

Insists Paulie empty his pockets and expels him from the gym for carrying drugs, showing concern for his well-being and future.

Quickly assesses the situation when the Toughs enter the gym and confidently confronts them, defusing the conflict.

Pressures Paulie to make a life choice between negative options and encourages wrestling as a better path.
Softens after Paulie's apology and encourages him by acknowledging his talent and potential.
Responds curtly and bluntly to multiple wrestlers asking if they can be as good as Saraya.
Softens his blunt response by encouraging the group to work hard and continue training.
Encourages Paulie by acknowledging his talent and telling him he could be as good as Zak if he focuses and works hard.
Responds curtly and bluntly to the group’s question about being as good as Saraya, surprising everyone but maintaining authority.
Softens after bluntness and motivates the group to work hard and resume training with renewed vigor.

Politely thanks Hutch after receiving feedback on his tape.
Asks to speak to someone higher up after being rejected, showing persistence but no warmth-related behavior.
Performs in a tough cage match despite being hurt (tacks in his back), showing physical resilience and commitment.
Responds politely and professionally to feedback from Hutch, showing maturity and confidence.
Asks to speak to someone higher up after rejection, demonstrating persistence and proactive behavior.
Despite impressive performance and positive feedback, fails to secure approval or advancement, indicating possible limitations in influence or negotiation.

Shows anger by punching the wheel after the call ends, indicating difficulty managing emotions in stressful moments.
Pleading persistently with Hutch to reconsider the decision, offering to work harder and train more.
Unable to change the decision despite efforts, shows desperation and frustration by punching the wheel and sitting alone in the rain.
Considers answering Raya's call but chooses to cancel instead.

Considers answering a call from Raya but chooses to cancel instead.
